text: hello everyone welcome to my
demonstration of creating an Amazon EBS
volume
let's get started
there will be three portions to this
demonstration number one how do you
launch a new ec2 instance and attach an
EPS volume to it number two how do you
add more EBS volumes to an ec2 instance
and finally number three how do you
remove EBS volumes and ec2 instances to
clean up your demo environment
let us start with section one
how do you launch a new ec2 instance and
attach EPS volume to it
log into your account in the AWS
Management console
you will be greeted with a landing page
similar to the one displayed here
to begin select on ec2 if ec2 is not
displayed type ec2 in the top search
field and click on it
for this demonstration we will be
launching a new Amazon ec2 instance and
then attaching EBS volumes to it
on the ec2 dashboard select launch
instance to open the drop down menu and
then choose launch instance from the
menu
on this page provide a name for the ec2
instance
in this case the name provided is demo
underscore ec2 underscore instance
next you can leave everything as the
default settings for the application and
Os images that is the Amazon machine
image section or you can modify these
settings here to configure a different
image
next scroll down did you see configure
storage section
in this section you will see that by
default there is an unencrypted 8
gigabytes gp3 volume attached as the
root volume for the instance
you can change the volume type using an
option in the drop down list as well as
change the volume size from 8 gigabytes
to what you desire
in this demonstration example we will
keep the volume type as gp3 which is the
default
if you would like the volume to be
encrypted you can change the setting on
the advanced settings page however for
this demonstration the volume will be
kept as unencrypted
Additionally you can add more volumes
for data or other uses from here by
selecting the add new volume button
you can select from any volume type and
specify a size that is permitted for the
selected volume type
once done make sure that you select an
appropriate key pair that will be used
to log into the instance
in this case a new key pair named demo
underscore key was created
once that is done select on launch
instance to launch the instance and
create the ABS volumes
once the instance is launched select the
instance ID as shown here
you are then taken to the instances page
and you can view the instance details
here
on this page you can select the storage
tab here you will see all the EBS
volumes that you attach to this instance
when you created the instance
this completes the section 1 of our
demonstration
now for section 2 we will learn about
how to add more EBS volumes to an
existing ec2 instance
if you want to create and attach
additional EBS volumes to an ec2
instance first select the volumes tab in
the left navigation pane
your existing volumes are displayed on
this page
now select create volume in the upper
right corner of the page
here select the volume type and input
the size of the volume you want to
create
make sure that the availability Zone
selected is the same where the ec2
instance was previously launched
once done scroll down and select on
create volume
your newly created volume is displayed
on the volumes page in the available
state
available volumes have been created but
are not attached to an ec2 instance
to attach the volume to an ec2 instance
first select the volume
then select actions to open the actions
menu
then choose attach volume
select the instance ID from the drop
down list of ec2 instances and leave
everything else as default and then
select attach volume to attach this
volume to your selected ec2 instance
to verify that your newly created volume
is attached to your chosen ec2 instance
select instances on the ec2 console from
the left navigation pane then select the
ec2 instance and then select the storage
tag
your newly created and attached EBS
volume will be displayed in the attached
state
that wraps up section 2 of our
demonstration
now for Section 3 we will learn about
how do you remove EPS volumes and ec2
instances to clean up your demo
environment
you must terminate all the AWS service
resources that you created as a part of
this demonstration to avoid any further
cost
to begin on the instances page first
select the demo underscore ec2
underscore instance then select the
instant State drop down menu button and
then choose terminate instance
here confirm that you want to terminate
the instance by selecting terminate
on the instances page you will see the
instance State changed to terminated
please note that deleting the ec2
instance will delete only the ec2
instance as well as the root volume or
other EBS volumes set to terminate with
the ec2 instance
you still need to manually delete the
other EBS volumes that were attached to
your ec2 instance
locate these volumes by first going to
the volumes page under the volume tab
from the left navigation Pane and then
select the remaining demo EBS volumes
you then select the actions drop down
menu button in the upper right part of
the screen and then choose delete volume
the confirmation box is displayed to
confirm that you want to delete the EPS
volumes type in delete in the provided
field and then select delete
you have now cleaned up your Amazon ec2
and Amazon EBS resources that were
created during this demonstration
and with that concludes our
demonstration
thank you everyone for following along
and you have good rest of your day
